alert.note: Alert for Estill; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:11PM EST until February 19 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following river in Kentucky... Red River at Clay City affecting Estill and Powell Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River at Clay City. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Saturday the stage was 18.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM EST Saturday was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after 12 am EST Sunday and continue falling to 4.8 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.3 feet on 05/01/2005. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued by 4 am EST Sunday.
